item.title: Urgent Request for Signage Improvements – Bovey Path, Bevercote Walk & Everett Walk, 20th November
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise concerns regarding the inadequate and deteriorating signage in and around Bovey Path, Bevercote Walk, and Everett Walk. The current state of signage is causing significant confusion and delays for visitors, delivery drivers, and—most critically—emergency services attempting to navigate the area. While I note that signage has recently been updated in Croft Close and the lower-numbered section of Bovey Path, the rear access points remain neglected. Specifically: • Everett Walk, Bevercote Walk, and higher-numbered Bovey Path lack clear, legible signage. • Many signs are tatty, faded, or illegible, undermining their purpose. • The 'Path' signs themselves require updating to meet current visibility and accessibility standards. • The 'No Motorcycles' sign is outdated and no longer appropriate for the area’s usage—please arrange for its removal. This oversight is not merely cosmetic—it poses a real risk to public safety and access. I urge the council to conduct a full audit of signage in the affected areas and implement prompt remedial action, including: • Replacement of all rear access signs with clear, durable, and visible alternatives. • Review and update of all 'Path' signage to ensure consistency and legibility. • Removal of the redundant 'No Motorcycles' sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Everett Walk, Upper Belvedere, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Westdale Road, 20th November
item.description:
A large cardboard box that is half full of rubbish has been dumped at the top of Westdale Road. Further down the road on the pavement opposite 6A, there are a couple of bags of rubbish that have already been reported via FixMyStreet on two occasions, the first time was 1st July (FixMyStreet ref: 7791730). Please can this rubbish be removed at the same time as the box at the top of the road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westdale Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless have raided bins again, 20th November
item.description:
Our bins have been raided by the homeless again this week. They came with a trolley looking for stuff to take. They just throw everything on the street. We need bins emptied more frequently by the council or locks added to them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakley Place, Old Kent Road, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Pavement parking, 20th November
item.description:
Am literally sick n tired n in therapy or stuck home the last few weeks as I can deal with this no more am not an inferior person am not the only one having issues We have the asbo with the police we will be discussing it at our next Sydenham ward meeting submitting emails n pic I know you are call to so many places And I don't want to come out school run time but they are not being nice n my life shouldn't keep changing for them to cause me distress thank u for your support
